page.title: 12 LIFE STYLES II
page.content: Many children in Cannock are members of various clubs and associations. In a survey carried out at Chadsmoor Junior school, 10 girls were Guides,30 were Brownies,21 boys were Cubs,3 were Scouts. A large proportion of children attended a youth club or sports club and even more were learning to play a musical instrument. Another group of children prefered outdoor activities ranging from B.M.X bike racing to fishing. A number of girls and boys went to dancing class to learn anything from ballet to breakdancing. On Sundays 47 of the children surveyed went to Sunday school on a regular basis.
